document.masterDocTitle: Checklist of the Arctiidae (Lepidoptera: Insecta) of the continental United States and Canada

a. schwarziorum (Dyar, 1899 ), new combination [Formerly treated as a synonym of
tenuifascia
; facies of specimens from Arizona, including those from the type locality of schwarziorum , are distinct from those of nomenotypic
tenuifascia
from Texas.]

a. tooele (Barnes & McDunnough, 1910 ophir (Barnes & McDunnough, 1910 )

99 .
incorrupta (Henry Edwards, 1881 )
[We are selecting as the lectotype of
incorrupta
a specimen labeled Prescott, Arizona, which will establish it as the name that applies to the form from Arizona, New Mexico , and Texas. This action is taken in order to stabilize the nomenclature because the next available name, sulphurica Neumoegen, is based on an aberrant yellow specimen.]
ochracea (Neumoegen, 1883 )
[Homonym]

oithona (Strecker, 1878 )
,
new synonymy
. [This taxon was listed as a distinct species by
Franclemont ( 1983 )
.]

by
Franclemont ( 1983 )
.] dodgei (Butler, 1881 )

PAREUCHAETES Grote, 1865

pudens (Henry Edwards, 1882 )
,
new synonymy
. [This taxon previously was treated as a separate species, and
collaris
was treated as a junior synonym of
tenera Hübner. Examination
of the type of
collaris
showed it to be conspecific with
pudens
.]

170 . tenerosa (Dyar, 1913 ),
new U.S. record
. [This species, described from Mexico , has been recorded in Texas and Florida based on material examined by Ferguson, including specimens in the National Museum of Natural History.]

sciurus (Boisduval, 1869 )
, revised synonymy . [This taxon previously was treated as a subspecies of
tenera
, but lack of geographic variation in the species makes application of trinomials untenable.] yosemite (Henry Edwards, 1884 )

[ NOTE :
Halysidota underwoodi Rothschild
and
H. fuliginosa Rothschild
, reported from the U.S. by
Watson ( 1980 )
, are eliminated from the list because the records were almost certainly based on mislabeled specimens. Intensive collecting has provided no further indication that these species are present in Florida, Texas, or California.]

and deposited in the U.S. National Museum of Natural History.]

subSubSection.paragraph:
MASTIGOCERA Harris, 1839
PHYLLOECIA Guérin­Méneville, 1843 CALLICARUS Grote, 1866

[ NOTE : The two species of
Afrida
included by
Franclemont ( 1983 )
are related to the type species,
A. tortriciformis Möschler
, from Jamaica ;
Kitching and Rawlins ( 1999 )
removed Afridini from Arctiidae . Ferguson believed that
Afrida exegens Dyar
is not congeneric with other species of
Afrida
and requires a new generic name. In addition, Ferguson suspected that exergens may be a lithosiine; therefore we retain
exegens
as an unplaced arctiid.]

282 .
exegens Dyar, 1922
,
new U.S. record.
[Specimens from Arizona and Texas were examined by Ferguson.]

[ NOTE :
Comachara cadburyi Franclemont
has been transferred to the Noctuidae .]
